method.name: PUT
method.doc: The USC - Create Account mechanism must be correctly configured before the policy workflow can successfully respond to any runtime requests. Information about its configuration is available under the Configuring Authentication topics of the IBM Knowledge Center.

PUT requests are used to verify credentials. Once a valid authentication state context has been established for a policy that includes the USC - Create Account authentication mechanism, and that mechanism is current for the active state, then the requester may validate the USC - Create Account authentication.

The requester sends a PUT request to the authentication service API endpoint. The URI includes a dynamically generated state identifier. The URI can be easily obtained from the 'location' attribute from the previous JSON response data.

request.doc: The requester must maintain cookies returned by this API and send them on subsequent requests such as PUT requests to verify credentials
